oai_dc:dc.dc:title: A STEADY-STATE WAVE MODEL FOR COASTAL APPLICATIONS
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Resio, Donald T.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: steady state wave
wave model
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A steady-state spectral model is presented. This model produces a solution equivalent to a full time-stepping spectral model, but at much reduced computational times. Comparisons shown here demonstrate that the spectral model provides a good representation of shallow-water wave propagation phenomena and that wind effects can significantly influence near-coast wave conditions.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 21 (1988): Proceedings of 21st Conference on Coastal Engineering, Torremolinos, Spain, 1988.; 69
